BREWSTER: But you’re.. you're...
MENZIES: What?
BREWSTER: A woman!
MENZIES: I thought you said you knew I could change my appearance.
BREWSTER: Yeah, but.. only up to a point!
MENZIES: You're surprised? You should have been there when it happened! Poor old Norm didn’t know where to look!
BREWSTER: You mean, you used to be a male Doctor, and now you’re —
MENZIES: - wearing court shoes, yes. Must admit, it took some time getting used to —
DOCTOR: You can say that again!
BREWSTER: You’re really the Doctor?
MENZIES: Oh, yes.
BREWSTER: Well, in that case — I need your help.
BREWSTER: FADE/MUSIC TO:
DOCTOR WHO: THE GATHERING SWARM by Jonathan Morris (005) Page 102
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 62: INT. TUBE PLATFORM
ANNOUNCER: The next train is for all stations to Aldgate. All stations to Aldgate.
ANNOUNCER: BREWSTER, MENZIES AND THE DOCTOR ARE WALKING ALONG THE PLATFORM, SPEAKING LOUDLY TO BE HEARD OVER THE NOISE OF INCOMING TRAIN.
BREWSTER: It started about six months ago, when the Locus first made contact. They were asking after you. Said the Doctor had sorted them out before, and they needed his help.
MENZIES: So you decided to assist this ‘Locus’ by providing weapons and human bodies?
BREWSTER: Hey, it was the best I could come up with.
DOCTOR: And how have you been delivering your ‘volunteers’? To pass through a temporal breach would need some form of transport...
DOCTOR: BLIND.
BREWSTER: How do you think?
MENZIES: Sorry, you sent them to an alien planet... by tube?
BREWSTER: Get in.
BREWSTER: FADE/MUSIC TO:
DOCTOR WHO: THE GATHERING SWARM by Jonathan Morris (005) Page 103
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 63: EXT. JUNGLE ON THE PLANET SYMBIOS
DOCTOR WHO: ARRIVAL OF TUBE TRAIN, AS BEFORE. BEAT. DOORS WHOOSH OPEN.
BREWSTER: (GETTING OUT) And here we are. The planet Symbios.
DOCTOR: Extraordinary.. An entire tube train shifted through a space- time wormhole!
BREWSTER: (TO MENZIES) Had a lot of experience of this sort of thing, your ‘companion’?
MENZIES: I’m, uh, training him up. He’s doing alright, most of the time.
DOCTOR: Can’t say I’m overwhelmed by Symbios - except by the smell.
BREWSTER: (TO MENZIES) If you could tell ‘Norman’ to step this way, Doctor — the interface is only open for about a minute —
MENZIES: I get it. You don’t want the, uhhhhh —
DOCTOR: (VERY SOTTO) — Terravore —
MENZIES: . Terravore to discover your short-cut?
BREWSTER: Exactly. If they ever found the interface and used it to travel to Earth... it doesn’t bear thinking about.
DOCTOR: I can understand you wanting to help this ‘Locus’, Thomas — your intentions are admirable, even if your methods are not... but why pretend to be the Doctor-?
MENZIES: Yeah, why pretend to be me?
DOCTOR WHO: THE GATHERING SWARM by Jonathan Morris (005) Page 104
BREWSTER: Because the Doctor was who the Locus wanted. If they knew who I really was they wouldn’t have trusted me, would they — (TRAILS OFF) Norm, mate? Why are you looking at me like that?
DOCTOR: Me? I’m not looking at you like anything. —
BREWSTER: Good. —
DOCTOR: I’m looking at the people behind you.
BREWSTER: (TURNING) Oh, what-?
BREWSTER: ALL HAVE BEEN POSSESSED BY THE LOCUS. MAYBE VOICE EFFECT.
FLIP: (STEPPING FORWARD) We know the truth.
JARED: (STEPPING FORWARD) We know you are not the Doctor.
EVELYN: (STEPPING FORWARD) The woman Smythe told us everything, before we occupied her form.
DOCTOR: You did what?
EVELYN: We are Locus. The voice of this planet.
MENZIES: Sorry, repeat?
EVELYN: We are the Locus. And we have been betrayed. Take him!
BREWSTER: What? What, no? You have to listen to me! Alright, so I’m not
BREWSTER: the Doctor, but I brought you bodies, didn’t I?
DOCTOR: Let him go!
FLIP: What?
DOCTOR WHO: THE GATHERING SWARM by Jonathan Morris (005) Page 105
DOCTOR: You asked for the Doctor. Well, now you have the genuine article.
JARED: The genuine article?
MENZIES: Me. It’s me. I’m the Doctor.
EVELYN: Then... prove it.
EVELYN: FADE/MUSIC TO:
DOCTOR WHO: THE GATHERING SWARM by Jonathan Morris (005) Page 106
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 64: EXT. JUNGLE ON THE PLANET SYMBIOS
DOCTOR WHO: MUD.
MENZIES: (SOTTO) What was I supposed to say? I can’t prove I’m the Doctor!
DOCTOR: (SOTTO) Don’t worry. If this ‘Locus’ isn’t prepared to believe you.. then that’s their problem.
BREWSTER: (SOTTO) Really? That’s it, that’s the best you can do?
MENZIES: (SOTTO) Oh, because your plan was working so well, you mean?
BREWSTER: (SOTTO) Hey, I make a more convincing Doctor than you!
MENZIES: (SOTTO) Yeah, you can take the boy out of the Victorian age, but...
DOCTOR: (STRIDING FORWARD) Er — Locus. Tell me about yourself, I’ve never addressed a living planet before.
EVELYN: Who are you to ask?
DOCTOR: Oh, no-one, just the Doctor’s companion, it’s kind of my job to ask stupid questions.
EVELYN: We are the Locus. We are all around you.
FLIP: In every organism, in every cell.
JARED: The ground beneath your feet, the air you breathe.
DOCTOR: Interesting, but that doesn’t really explain much. Wait... Symbios. A planet of symbiosis! Different organisms acting together as one...
EVELYN: All life on Symbios exists in harmony.
DOCTOR WHO: THE GATHERING SWARM by Jonathan Morris (005) Page 107
DOCTOR: Yes. One organism. But that should be an evolutionary dead- end... except one part of you kept on developing, didn’t it? The
DOCTOR: genetic inheritance!
FLIP: You comprehend our true nature?
DOCTOR: I’m beginning to. The genes themselves evolved their own independent intelligence! Like.. oh, I don’t know, computer viruses! Ghosts in the biological machine!
MENZIES: Norman — look!
DOCTOR: Who? Oh, you mean me — Oh no, it seems our presence has been noted.
BREWSTER: The Terravore.
EVELYN: Remain where you are. You will be absorbed by Symbios.
MENZIES: What?
FLIP: You shall be conveyed beneath the surface.
BREWSTER: It’s alright, I’ve done it a hundred times. Just - hold still.
DOCTOR: Well, if you’re sure —
TERRAVORE: Detect trace of Doctor! Detect trace of Doctor!
TERRAVORE: UNDER THE SURFACE. LEAVING THE SOUND OF BUBBLING MUD.
DOCTOR WHO: THE GATHERING SWARM by Jonathan Morris (005) Page 108
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 65: INT. UNDERGROUND TUNNEL ON SYMBIOS.
DOCTOR WHO: ALL EMERGE FROM MUD.
MENZIES: That... was disgusting.
BREWSTER: Don’t worry, it’ll slide off in a minute. It’s bile, mostly.
MENZIES: Bile?!?
EVELYN: The Terravore.. they identified you as the Doctor.
MENZIES: What? Oh, yes, I suppose they did.
DOCTOR: So now you know you can trust us. Your enemy’s enemy!
FLIP: The Doctor visited Symbios many years ago —
JARED: - and saved us from the [Drahvin menace —]
DOCTOR: (LOUD) Lalalalala! Lalalalala!
MENZIES: What are you doing, ‘Norman’?
DOCTOR: Locus, I’m afraid as far as the Doctor here is concerned, that particular encounter has yet to take place.. So if you could keep the details to yourself, it would be much appreciated!
EVELYN: We understand. (TO MENZIES) So, will you assist us?
MENZIES: L<—
DOCTOR: The Doctor has three conditions.
JARED: Doesn’t the Doctor speak for herself?
DOCTOR WHO: THE GATHERING SWARM by Jonathan Morris (005) Page 109
MENZIES: No, it’s okay, I’m training him. Work experience. Go on, Norm.
DOCTOR: Condition one. You return the minds of all the people you have kidnapped. I’1l talk to them, I’m sure they’1ll agree to help of their own accord.
EVELYN: We shall do this. Save for this form.
DOCTOR: What? No, no exceptions.
EVELYN: For communication purposes only. When the Terravore are defeated, her mind shall also be returned.
DOCTOR: (CONSIDERS) Very well.
FLIP: Your second condition?
DOCTOR: All the humans must be returned safely to Earth.
JARED: Agreed. And your third?
DOCTOR: My third condition is that you listen carefully, and do exactly as I say...
DOCTOR: FADE/MUSIC TO:
DOCTOR WHO: THE GATHERING SWARM by Jonathan Morris (005) Page 110
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 66: EXT. JUNGLE ON THE PLANET SYMBIOS
MENZIES: I still don’t see why Symbios couldn’t have brought us here.
DOCTOR: Have you ever travelled intravenously? It’s not pleasant.
BREWSTER: (JOINING THEM) Right. The Terravore hive-ship’s about half a mile away.
MENZIES: Only half a mile? What a pity, this was turning into a nice ramble. The country air, the sound of birdsong...
DOCTOR: And the Terravore?
BREWSTER: They’re swarming all around the ship. There’s no way we can get inside with them seeing us.
DOCTOR: Then let’s hope the others are ready with the diversion!
DOCTOR WHO: THE GATHERING SWARM by Jonathan Morris (005) Page 111
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 67: EXT. JUNGLE ON THE PLANET SYMBIOS
DOCTOR WHO: OF A CLUMN OF ARMED HUMANOIDS — CLANKING MACHINE GUNS.
JARED: This is so mad, Flip - a few hours ago we were on our way to Marty’s twenty-first, now we’re on an alien planet getting ready to zap alien invaders with machine guns!
FLIP: Not as mad as you volunteering for it!
JARED: Come on, this is brilliant. This is better than Call Of Duty or Avatar. This is seriously hardcore!
FLIP: (STOPPING) And when we get killed?
EVELYN: You shall not come to any harm.
FLIP: Forgive me for not having total faith in a living planet that talks through the body of an OA P!
JARED: All we have to do is get their attention. Ready, Flip?
FLIP: No, not remotely, but don’t wait on my behalf.
JARED: (ALOUD) And the rest of you, Clarkey, Sunetra, Ellie, Mrs Lewis?
JARED: Okay, let’s go. Lock and load!
DOCTOR WHO: THE GATHERING SWARM by Jonathan Morris (005) Page 112
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 68: EXT. JUNGLE ON THE PLANET SYMBIOS
DOCTOR WHO: TERRAVORE. MASSED TERRAVORE BUZZING.
TERRAVORE: (DISTANT) Terravore under attack! Terravore under attack!
BREWSTER: It’s working, those things are going after my gang.
DOCTOR: They’re not your gang any more, Thomas.
BREWSTER: Hey, this is exactly how things would’ve worked out if I was still in charge!
MENZIES: Could you two stop bickering for one moment? They’re leaving the hive-ship... come on!
MENZIES: TERRAVORE BUZZING AND BLASTING.
DOCTOR WHO: THE GATHERING SWARM by Jonathan Morris (005) Page 113
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 69: DELETED SCENE 70: INT. TERRAVORE HIVE-SHIP
MENZIES: Okay, we’re inside the ship, now what?
BREWSTER: Er, you’re the Doctor, aren’t you the one with the plan?
DOCTOR: What the Doctor meant to say was that we need to find the source of the control transmission.
MENZIES: That was what I meant to say. Sorry, my mind was on higher things.
DOCTOR: The transmission must be coming from somewhere in this ship.
MENZIES: Like, er, radio control.
BREWSTER: Oh, right.
DOCTOR: This way, I think, towards the centre?
MENZIES: If you say so, Norm, but I don’t want you getting into [trouble -]
BREWSTER: Oh my life! Doctor!!!
DOCTOR: Stay back, Brewster! There’s nothing you can do!
DOCTOR: TERRAVORE GLIDES INTO THE CHAMBER.
BREWSTER: What the hell is that?
DOCTOR WHO: THE GATHERING SWARM by Jonathan Morris (005) Page 114
DOCTOR: I’m guessing — the Terravore Queen!
BREWSTER: She’s massive!
BREWSTER: ELECTRONIC VOICE LIKE THE OTHER TERRAVORE BUT DEEPER, MORE IMPOSING.
TERRAVORE QUEEN: Do not approach the female organic.
BREWSTER: (WHISPER) Norman, the control signal!
DOCTOR: We’ve found it, Thomas. Don’t you see? The Terravore Queen is the control signal.
BREWSTER: What? But then, then — the Doctor’s plan has failed. These things have won. Everyone on this planet, they’re all gonna die!
BREWSTER: END OF PART THREE
DOCTOR WHO: THE GATHERING SWARM by Jonathan Morris (005) Page 115

FX: A LASER BEAM IS FIRED FROM OFF.
SCREAMS IN SUDDEN PAIN AS SHE IS BLASTED
Oh my life! Doctor!!!
Stay back, Brewster! There’s nothing you can do!
FX: WE HEAR A HUGE ELECTRONIC BUZZING AND HUMMING AS A GIANT
TERRAVORE GLIDES INTO THE CHAMBER.
What the hell is that?
I’m guessing — the Terravore Queen!
She’s massive!
FX: THE TERRAVORE SPEAKS. A SINISTER, WHIRRING, CLICKING
ELECTRONIC VOICE LIKE THE OTHER TERRAVORE BUT DEEPER, MORE IMPOSING.
Do not approach the female organic.
(WHISPER) Norman, the control signal!
We’ve found it, Thomas. Don’t you see? The Terravore Queen is the control signal.

SCENE CONTINUES:
SCENE 71: INT. TERRAVORE HIVE-SHIP
Is she dead? The female organic?
THE GATHERING SWARM by Jonathan Morris (005) Page 116
The human has not been eliminated. Her survival is conditional upon your co-operation.
FX: BUZZING OF MORE TERRAVORE ENTERING.
Oh, Lor’ — there’s more of them!
Drones! Transfer these organics to a brood chamber! Their mineral compounds will be assimilated by our young!
FADE/MUSIC TO:
THE GATHERING SWARM by Jonathan Morris (005) Page 117
SCENE 72: EXT. JUNGLE ON THE PLANET SYMBIOS
FX: JARED AND FLIP STILL TRAPPED BY BUZZING TERRAVORES.
Nothing’s happening, Jared. We’re surrounded and nothing’s
happening!
I don’t want to sound like a wuss, Flip — but I don’t want to die. I really, really don’t want to die!
It’s alright. Really. You don’t have to prove anything. — No, hold on, wait. (BEAT) They’re not firing!
You’re right.
FX: TERRAVORE BUZZING OVERHEAD. NO LONGER BLASTING.
Surrender weapons and you will not be eliminated.
Yeah, like we believe you.
(STEPPING FORWARD) But will you believe me?
Locus-?
Surrender your weapons. Now.
Suits me. (FX: DUMPS MACHINE GUN.)
I don’t get it. What’s going on? Locus!
FADE/MUSIC TO:
THE GATHERING SWARM by Jonathan Morris (005) Page 118
SCENE 73: INT. TERRAVORE BROOD CHAMBER
FX: A HIVE PORTAL WHIRRS SHUT. B/G NOISE OF TERRAVORE LARVAE.
(IN PAIN, HALF-WAKING) Where... where are we? I -
In the Terravore ship, in one of the brood cells.
It shot me — (MUMBLING, FALLS UNCONSCIOUS)
Great work. The Doctor’s dying and it’s all for nothing.
She can still survive. We have to get her to a hospital.
And how do you suggest we do that? We’re on the wrong side the galaxy, in case you hadn’t noticed!
(AGGRESSIVE) I don’t know, Thomas! I don’t know!
If I was the Doctor, you would never be my companion.
And if you were the Doctor, I wouldn’t want to be.
Thing is, I thought the Doctor was a Time Lord. But the Terravore Queen, she said the Doctor was a human.
Did she?
I’m not stupid.
No. No, you’re not stupid. Thomas Brewster — allow me to introduce Detective Inspector Patricia Menzies.
She’s a bluebottle? Blimey! (BEAT) So — you got a new boat race, then... Doctor?
I regenerated, yes.
of
THE GATHERING SWARM by Jonathan Morris (005) Page 119
Yeah, I thought the whole business about you turning into a lady was bit peculiar.
Quite. Now — I’ve been straight with you, you can be straight with me. Why did you re-activate your time machine?
What’s it to you?
Just tell me, Thomas. Please.
You remember — back in London, I’d met this girl, Connie.
Yes. Yes, I do.

Right charmer she was, real good-looking too. All set up, I was. Only — only one day, there was this accident. Nobody’s fault, the driver never saw her. (BEAT) She weren’t dead. It’s just, she weren’t ever gonna wake up. The doctors said — well, they said there weren’t any point in.. Oh, you know.
BEAT
Thomas, I’m so very sorry.
(SNIFFS) Well. After that, nothing went right. So I thought I’d see what’d happened to my time machine.
Because you wanted to travel back, to save Connie’s life?
Don’t mind admitting, the thought crossed my mind. But what’s done is done, and there’s no changing things.
Then why?

Come on, I wanted to get back to my own time. This century ain’t for me, all cars and aeroplanes and glass buildings and everyone talking every second of the day. I’m no good here. I want to be somewhere where I fit in.
THE GATHERING SWARM by Jonathan Morris (005) Page 120
Only when you tested the machine, the Locus made contact?
Yeah. Thought I’d found myself a mission in life. (BITTER) That’1ll teach me, won’t it, to get ideas above my station.
You did your best, Thomas. That’s all any of us can do.
FADE/MUSIC TO:
THE GATHERING SWARM by Jonathan Morris (005) Page 121
SCENE 74: EXT. JUNGLE ON THE PLANET SYMBIOS
FX: JUNGLE ATMOS.
(FX: LEADING BUZZING QUEEN FORWARD) This is the location of the space-time wormhole.
I detect no etheric disturbance.
We have agents on Earth, humans under our control. (HUMAN NAMES ARE UNFAMILIAR) They are... ‘Tricia Welsh’ and ‘Danny Coles’. They are due to open the temporal breach.
We are waiting for a ‘train’?
FX: THE TEMPORAL BREACH OPENING — IE AS WHEN THE TRAIN CAME
THROUGH, BUT WITHOUT TRAIN. WIBBLY TUNNEL EFFECTS.
No. No train. But your swarm may now leave Symbios, as we agreed.
Excellent. I shall gather the Terravore and send them to this new world, to prepare it for my triumph!
FADE/MUSIC TO:
THE GATHERING SWARM by Jonathan Morris (005) Page 122
SCENE 75: INT. GALLAGHER’S OFFICE
FX: PHONE RINGS.

(PICKING UP) Gallagher. [..] Well, where the hell are you? I got a half-dozen stiffs here, they ain’t gonna dump themselves in the Channel. [..] Your Mum’s birthday-?!? Now you listen to me, you doughnut — (FX: TERRAVORE BUZZES SUDDENLY INTO LIFE. ) Holy moly!
Contact has been restored.
Frightened the life out of me. (INTO PHONE) No, it wasn’t a wasp. Just get your backside over here, pronto. (FX: HANGS UP) (TO TERRAVORE) So. Up and about again, are you?
We have located Doctor’s temporal breach.
His what? Sounds medical.
Wormhole is located beneath Great Portland Street.
How do you know that?
My control signal is being relayed through wormhole.
OH; rrghts
Gallagher. Assemble your men. We must secure location for induction of Terravore swarm!
Whoa whoa whoa. We had an arrangement, remember?
In return for co-operation, you will be provided with as much reconstituted carbon content as you require.
Diamonds, my little friend! They’re called diamonds!
FADE/MUSIC TO:
THE GATHERING SWARM by Jonathan Morris (005) Page 123
SCENE 76: INT. TERRAVORE BROOD CHAMBER
FX: AS BEFORE.
Come on, Doctor, you must have some sort of plan to get us of here.
I always have a plan. It’s just that sometimes I haven’t thought of it yet...
FX: FOOTSTEPS IN CORRIDOR OUTSIDE.
Hey, shush - I think something’s coming.
(QUIET) Then this is our chance. Thomas, get ready —
FX: DOOR BUZZES OPEN.
Evelyn! — Oh. Still under the control of the Locus, I see.
Doctor. We have returned your friends to you.
JARED & FLIP: Doctor!
Oh, it’s you two.
Those Terravore things, they called off their attack —
- and took us prisoner. Short story!
They called off their attack, just like that?
We have secured your release. You are free to depart.
out
The Terravore wouldn’t let us go without good reason. So what
have you given them in return?
We are sorry. We had no choice.
THE GATHERING SWARM by Jonathan Morris (005) Page 124
You’ve told them where the wormhole is, haven’t you?
And in return, they have agreed to vacate this world.
Yeah, so they can devastate the Earth instead!
Sold us out, to save themselves!
Locus, do you have any idea what you’ve done? The Earth is home to a million species! Thanks to you, the Terravore will reduce it to dust!
Your lives have been spared. You should be grateful.
GROANS IN HER SLEEP
The Doctor is wounded! Why has she not renewed her form?
The Doctor is, ah, too seriously injured to regenerate. Unless she gets medical attention soon, she’1ll die!
Then perhaps this will convince you of our intentions.
FX: ALIEN THROBBING, REGENERATION, RUSHING SOUND.
AWAKES WITH A GASP
It’s cured her. It cured her!
What happened? I feel like death warmed up. Literally!
The Locus infuses every cell and particle on this world. There is no death here.
No death here-? Brewster, did you know this?
THE GATHERING SWARM by Jonathan Morris (005) Page 125
(BLUFFING) Of course! I wouldn’t have helped them out otherwise. What sort of idiot do you take me for?
You had no idea, did you?
(ADMITTING IT) No.
You may remain on Symbios for as long as you desire. You need
never die!
FADE/MUSIC TO:
THE GATHERING SWARM by Jonathan Morris (005) Page 126
SCENE 77: EXT. LONDON BACKSTREET
FX: VAN SCREECHES TO HALT. DOORS OPEN.
Alright, lads — everybody out!
FX: GOONS PILING OUT OF VAN.
(BUZZING OUT OF VAN) This location gives access to temporal breach?
The old Marlborough Road tube. Been shut since before the War. It was a Chinese restaurant til a couple of years back. The chopsticks used to rattle when the trains passed underneath...
(IMPATIENT) Is there access to temporal breach?

Southbound tunnel goes straight to Baker Street. Great Portland Street’s two minutes further on. (FX: RATTLES CHAINED DOOR) But first — we’d better bust our way through to the platforms. (ALOUD) Boys-!!!
FX: GRUNTS OF ASSENT FROM GOONS.
Physical force unnecessary. Order ancillaries to vacate immediate area.
Okay, you heard the daddy long-legs, get out of its way.
FX: GANGSTERS STEP BACK, MUTTERING. TERRAVORE BLASTS AND
EXPLOSION. CHAINED DOOR BLOWN APART. GANGSTERS REACT WITH SHOCK AND AWE.
(WHISTLE) That’s some serious firepower you have there.
Access to platforms facilitated.
There you go. What do we do next?
Maintain surveillance for human defensive response. Any attempt to disrupt induction must be eliminated.
THE GATHERING SWARM by Jonathan Morris (005) Page 127
It’ll be a pleasure. Lads — get ready for some action!
FX: GANGSTERS SHOUT AND TAKE POSITIONS, PREPARING GUNS.
FADE/MUSIC TO:
THE GATHERING SWARM by Jonathan Morris (005) Page 128
SCENE 78: INT. TERRAVORE HIVE-SHIP — CORRIDOR
FX: ALL WALKING.
Sorry, you’re the Doctor now?
The original and best!
Hey, where’s Miss Smythe — (CORRECTS SELF) — I mean, the Locus
gone?
Gone to bathe in bile, for all I care.
The old lady can wait. We need to get out of here-!
I recommend caution. The hive-ship may appear deserted, but...
Come off it, the swarm must be on their way to Earth already.
FX: A MOBILE PHONE RINGS.
What’s that?
Hey, don’t look at me, it’s not mine.
And it’s not mine, my ringtone is Poker Face by Lady Gaga.
Sorry, I think it’s mine — (ANSWERS PHONE) Yes?
THE GATHERING SWARM by Jonathan Morris (005) Page 129
SCENE 79: INT. POLICE HELICOPTER (IN FLIGHT)
D. I. Menzies? Where’ve you been, Ma’am, I’ve been trying to raise you for hours!
(VIA PHONE) Sergeant Bradshaw. Sorry, I’ve been... in an area with bad coverage. Are you up in that chopper again?
Yeah. You know that robot thing from last night? Well, we’re getting reports of more of them. A lot more of them.
(VIA PHONE) The Terravore?
What?
(VIA PHONE) They’re called Terravore. Singular and plural.
Well, whatever they’re called, they’re coming out of the underground, all over London!
(VIA PHONE) They’re in the underground?
We’ve ordered an evacuation of the Tube, but it’s not much good if we don’t know where they’re coming from!
(VIA PHONE) Try Great Portland Street.
Why Great Portland Street-?!?
(VIA PHONE)
You can either waste time listening as I try to explain how I know, or you can get down there and do whatever you have to do to stop them getting through.
Right. What about you? Where are you, anyway?
THE GATHERING SWARM by Jonathan Morris (005) Page 130
SCENE 80: INT. TERRAVORE HIVE-SHIP — CORRIDOR
It’s hard to explain. I’m, um, quite a way out of town.
(VIA PHONE) What? Like Zone Four?
Even further than that. Look, keep me in touch. (FX: PHONE OFF )
Hang about — you’re getting a signal in here?
Apparently. Look, five bars!
How peculiar. And it’s just an ordinary phone?
It hasn’t even got email, so I’d be surprised if it had roaming network capability on alien planets.
Let me see that.
Come on, we haven’t got time for you lot to play with your mobiles!
Brewster’s right. This is where we came in, I think. —
FX: EXTERIOR DOOR IS OPENED. SOUND OF ALIEN JUNGLE.
So where to now?
We have to get back to the space-time wormhole before it’s too late! Come on!
FADE/MUSIC TO:
THE GATHERING SWARM by Jonathan Morris (005) Page 131
SCENE 81: INT. POLICE HELICOPTER
FX: B/G ROTORS.
(INTO RADIO) Just heading down towards Great Portland Street now. We’re in the vicinity of the Finchley Road, ETA [minutes]
FX: BULLETS SPANG OFF HULL OF COPTER.
What the-? — We’re being shot at! I’m counting four, five, six guns, on the platform of the old Marlborough Road station —
FX: ANOTHER SPRAY OF MACHINE GUN FIRE.
What do they think they’re playing at-?!?
FX: MASSED TERRAVORE BUZZING BELOW.
. Oh, it gets better. We’ve got more of those giant robot mosquitoes swarming out of the station like, well, like giant robot mosquitoes!
FX: MORE GUNFIRE.
. Yeah, they’ve definitely noticed us. (TO PILOT) Get us out of here! Get us out of here, now! SCENE 82: INT. GREAT PORTLAND STREET PLATFORM
FX: REVERSE OF WORMHOLE EFFECT AS DOCTOR AND CO REMATERIALIZE
